cards.title: Memory Lane / Royal Ascot down the years

item.title: Memory Lane: Royal Ascot down the years
item.trailText: We have had a rummage through the archives to take a look at the racegoers, and a bit of racing, from yesteryear
item.standFirst: We have had a rummage through the archives to take a look at the racegoers, and a bit of racing, from yesteryear

displayImages.caption: Circa 1865 A crowd of racegoers on the grandstand at Ascot. Photograph: Hulton Archive/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Circa 1865 A crowd of racegoers on the grandstand at Ascot
displayImages.cleanCaption: Circa 1865 A crowd of racegoers on the grandstand at Ascot.

displayImages.caption: 1912 The Prince of Wales’s Stakes at Ascot. Photograph: Topical Press Agency/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1912 The Prince of Wales’s Stakes at Ascot.
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1912 The Prince of Wales’s Stakes at Ascot.

displayImages.caption: 1921 Racegoers tuck into a picnic by the side of their car. Photograph: Topical Press Agency/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1921 Racegoers tuck into a picnic by the side of their car
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1921 Racegoers tuck into a picnic by the side of their car.

displayImages.caption: 1922: Major and Mrs Hedges stride purposefully about in their finery. Photograph: Topical Press Agency/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1922:  Major and Mrs Hedges stride purposefully about in their finery
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1922: Major and Mrs Hedges stride purposefully about in their finery.

displayImages.caption: 1924 A horse racing official testing the scales in the jockey’s weighing room in preparation for Royal Ascot. Photograph: Topical Press Agency/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1924 A horse racing official testing the scales in the jockey’s weighing room in preparation for Royal Ascot.
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1924 A horse racing official testing the scales in the jockey’s weighing room in preparation for Royal Ascot.

displayImages.caption: 1928 Brown Jack, ridden by Steve Donoghue, wins the Ascot Stakes. The following year at Royal Ascot Brown Jack triumphed in the first of his six consecutive Queen Alexandra Stakes, the longest race in the Flat racing calendar. His sequence of victories made him one of the most popular racehorses in the history of British racing, and he is described in the meeting’s official guide as “arguably Royal Ascot’s greatest equine legend”. A bronze statue of Brown Jack, by the equestrian painter Sir Alfred Munnings, can be found at Ascot. Photograph: ANL/Rex Shutterstock
displayImages.altText: 1928 Brown Jack, ridden by Steve Donoghue, wins the Ascot Stakes. The following year at Royal Ascot Brown Jack triumphed in the first of his six consecutive Queen Alexandra Stakes, the longest race in the Flat racing calendar. His sequence of victories made him one of the most popular racehorses in the history of British racing, and he is described in the meeting’s official guide as “arguably Royal Ascot’s greatest equine legend”. A bronze statue of Brown Jack, by the equestrian painter Sir Alfred Munnings, can be found at Ascot.
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1928 Brown Jack, ridden by Steve Donoghue, wins the Ascot Stakes. The following year at Royal Ascot Brown Jack triumphed in the first of his six consecutive Queen Alexandra Stakes, the longest race in the Flat racing calendar. His sequence of victories made him one of the most popular racehorses in the history of British racing, and he is described in the meeting’s official guide as “arguably Royal Ascot’s greatest equine legend”. A bronze statue of Brown Jack, by the equestrian painter Sir Alfred Munnings, can be found at Ascot.

displayImages.caption: 1930 Racegoers walk through a field on their way from the railway station to the Royal Enclosure at Ascot. Photograph: Topical Press Agency/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1930 Racegoers walk through a field on their way from the railway station to the Royal Enclosure at Ascot
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1930 Racegoers walk through a field on their way from the railway station to the Royal Enclosure at Ascot.

displayImages.caption: 1931 Racegoers mingle around the paddock in front of the newly constructed Totalisator. The building cost over £100,000 to erect. The smaller buildings next to the Tote board were also erected and there were 360 pigeon holes for racegoers to place their bets. Photograph: J. A. Hampton/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1931 Racegoers mingle around the paddock in front of the newly constructed Totalisator. The building cost over £100,000 to erect. The smaller buildings next to the Tote board were also erected and there were 360 pigeon holes for racegoers to place their bets.
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1931 Racegoers mingle around the paddock in front of the newly constructed Totalisator. The building cost over £100,000 to erect. The smaller buildings next to the Tote board were also erected and there were 360 pigeon holes for racegoers to place their bets.

displayImages.caption: 1933 Two women dressed up for the second day at Royal Ascot. Photograph: Topical Press Agency/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1933 Two women dressed up for the second day at Royal Ascot
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1933 Two women dressed up for the second day at Royal Ascot.

displayImages.caption: 1935 Fashionable racegoers stop to listen to an accordion player and admire his pet monkey on the first day of Royal Ascot. Photograph: Topical Press Agency/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1935 Fashionable racegoers stop to listen to an accordion player and admire his pet monkey on the first day of Royal Ascot
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1935 Fashionable racegoers stop to listen to an accordion player and admire his pet monkey on the first day of Royal Ascot.

displayImages.caption: 1938 Frawn wins the Ascot Stakes on the opening day of the meeting. On the left of the track is the traditional runners and riders board giving information on the races. Photograph: Popperfoto/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1938 Frawn wins the Ascot Stakes on the opening day of the meeting. On the left of the track is the traditional runners and riders board giving information on the races.
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1938 Frawn wins the Ascot Stakes on the opening day of the meeting. On the left of the track is the traditional runners and riders board giving information on the races.

displayImages.caption: 1950 Supertello wins the Ascot Gold Cup from Bagheera. Photograph: ANL/Rex Shutterstock
displayImages.altText: 1950 Supertello wins the Ascot Gold Cup from Bagheera.
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1950 Supertello wins the Ascot Gold Cup from Bagheera.

displayImages.caption: 1953 Excitement in the royal box as the Queen’s horse, Choir Boy, wins the Royal Hunt Cup. Queen Elizabeth II is accompanied by the Queen Mother and Princess Marina, Duchess of Kent. Photograph: Fox Photos/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1953 Excitement in the royal box as the Queen’s horse, Choir Boy, wins the Royal Hunt Cup. Queen Elizabeth II is accompanied by the Queen Mother and Princess Marina, Duchess of Kent.
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1953 Excitement in the royal box as the Queen’s horse, Choir Boy, wins the Royal Hunt Cup. Queen Elizabeth II is accompanied by the Queen Mother and Princess Marina, Duchess of Kent.

displayImages.caption: 1955 The Marchesa Incisa della Rocchetta’s Botticelli, ridden by E Camici, wins the Gold Cup as he strides to a length victory in the race at the Royal Ascot meeting. The Queen and other members of the Royal family watched the race, which had been put forward a day at Her Majesty’s request. Photograph: PA Archive
displayImages.altText: 1955 The Marchesa Incisa della Rocchetta’s Botticelli, ridden by E Camici, wins the Gold Cup as he strides to a length victory in the race at the Royal Ascot meeting. The Queen and other members of the Royal family watched the race, which had been put forward a day at Her Majesty’s request.
displayImages.cleanCaption: 1955 The Marchesa Incisa della Rocchetta’s Botticelli, ridden by E Camici, wins the Gold Cup as he strides to a length victory in the race at the Royal Ascot meeting. The Queen and other members of the Royal family watched the race, which had been put forward a day at Her Majesty’s request.

displayImages.cleanCaption: 1964 Four empty champagne bottles rest in a puddle at Ascot racecourse, where racing had been abandoned for the second day due to the waterlogged state of the course.

displayImages.caption: 1965 Lester Piggott on Casablanca (No3) wins the the Royal Hunt Cup. Piggott is the most successful jockey in Royal Ascot history with 116 winners in total. Photograph: Central Press/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: 1965 Lester Piggott on Casablanca (No3) wins the the Royal Hunt Cup. Piggott is the most successful jockey in Royal Ascot history with 116 winners in total.

displayImages.caption: 1971 Fashion designer Joe Dalyland wearing hot pants to escort his model Delia Whittaker. This was after the Duke of Norfolk decreed that hot pants for women were unsuitable at Royal Ascot. Photograph: PA Archive

cards.title: Volleyball / Women forbidden from 'Freedom' Stadium as Iran beat USA in Tehran
cards.rawTitle: Women forbidden from 'Freedom' Stadium as Iran beat USA in Tehran

item.title: Women forbidden from 'Freedom' Stadium as Iran beat USA in Tehran volleyball clash
item.trailText: A large police presence outside the Azadi (Freedom) arena ensured that female spectators and journalists did not attend the volleyball match between Iran and the US in Tehran
item.standFirst: A large police presence outside the Azadi (Freedom) arena ensured that female spectators and journalists did not attend the volleyball match between Iran and the US in Tehran. Authorities backtracked on the loosening of restrictions on females watching sport events in the country. Influential religious factions are concerned that it will contribute to the disintegration of traditional society. Iran won 3-0 in what was the first international volleyball fixture since a British-Iranian woman was pardoned in April after serving a jail sentence for protesting the ban on females attending matches

displayImages.altText: Male spectators cheer as Iran defeat the US 3-0 in the first international volleyball fixture since a British-Iranian woman was pardoned in April after serving a jail sentence for protesting the ban on females attending matches.

headerImage.caption: Male spectators cheer as Iran defeat the US 3-0 in the first international volleyball fixture since a British-Iranian woman was pardoned in April after serving a jail sentence for protesting the ban on females attending matches. Photograph: Vahid Salemi/AP
headerImage.altText: Male spectators cheer as Iran defeat the US 3-0 in the first international volleyball fixture since a British-Iranian woman was pardoned in April after serving a jail sentence for protesting the ban on females attending matches.
headerImage.cleanCaption: Male spectators cheer as Iran defeat the US 3-0 in the first international volleyball fixture since a British-Iranian woman was pardoned in April after serving a jail sentence for protesting the ban on females attending matches.

image.altText: Male spectators cheer as Iran defeat the US 3-0 in the first international volleyball fixture since a British-Iranian woman was pardoned in April after serving a jail sentence for protesting the ban on females attending matches.

cards.title: Extreme sports / Pilots fly through building at 185mph

item.title: Pilots fly through a building at 185mph
item.trailText: Two British pilots fly through a building in formation, reaching speeds of 185mph and a lowest height of just one metre from the ground
item.standFirst: Two British pilots fly through a building in formation, reaching speeds of 185mph and a lowest height of just one metre from the ground. Paul Bonhomme and Steve Jones had to get special permission from the Civil Aviation Authority for the stunt, which took place on Llandbedr Airfield, north Wales

cards.title: Football / Neymar reflects on red card after Colombia beat Brazil
cards.rawTitle: Neymar reflects on red card after Colombia beat Brazil

item.title: Neymar reflects on red card after Colombia beat Brazil
item.trailText: Neymar says he made "a mistake" after being given a red card as Brazil lost to Colombia at the Copa America
item.standFirst: Neymar says he made a mistake in earning a red card after Brazil lost to Colombia at the Copa America. The referee acted after the Barcelona and Brazil forward kicked a ball at Colombia's Pablo Armero as the game came to an end. Carlos Bacca was also sent off after shoving Neymar. It is the first time Brazil have been beaten by Colombia since 1991

cards.title: Women's Tour Stage 2 / A rider's-eye view from Braintree to Clacton
cards.rawTitle: A rider's-eye view from Braintree to Clacton

item.title: Tour of Britain Stage 2: a rider's-eye view from Braintree to Clacton
item.trailText: Essex in mere seconds as the peloton travels through a new venue for 2015. The event is the biggest women's cycling race in the UK, with a total of 16 teams and a field that includes 12 different national champions and seven of the 10 highest-ranked riders in the world
item.standFirst: A view (Google Street View, to be precise) over the handlebars of the cyclists competing in the second stage of the women's Tour of Britain on Thursday. Glide through Essex in mere seconds as the peloton travels through a new venue for 2015. The event is the biggest women's cycling race in the UK, with a total of 16 teams and a field that includes 12 different national champions and seven of the 10 highest-ranked riders in the world

cards.title: Cycling / Armitstead crashes at finish line during Women’s Tour
cards.rawTitle: Armitstead crashes at finish line during Women’s Tour

item.title: Lizzie Armitstead crashes at finish line during Women’s Tour
item.trailText: The Olympic silver medallist Lizzie Armitstead crashes at the end of the first stage of the Women's Tour on Wednesday
item.standFirst:
The Olympic silver medallist Lizzie Armitstead crashes at the end of the first stage of the Women's Tour on Wednesday. Armitstead is seen crossing the line first following the leg from Bury St Edmunds to Aldeburgh and then brushing a photographer while celebrating. The 26-year-old was later taken to hospital

Warning: video contains images that may disturb

cards.title: NBA finals / Warriors fans fill streets of Oakland after title triumph
cards.rawTitle: Warriors fans fill streets of Oakland after title triumph

item.title: NBA finals: Warriors fans fill streets of Oakland after taking title to Golden State
item.trailText: Golden State Warriors supporters celebrate in Oakland after their team won the NBA championship
item.standFirst: Golden State Warriors celebrate in Oakland after their team won the NBA championship. The California franchise beat LeBron James's Cleveland Cavaliers, winning 105-97 in game six to take the title to Oakland

stillImage.caption: OAKLAND, CA - JUNE 16:  Golden State Warriors fans celebrate their team's 2015 NBA Finals win Photograph: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images North America Photograph: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images North America
